info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 20 at 5:16AM CDT until July 20 at 11:15AM CDT by NWS Quad Cities IA IL
info.description:
FFWDVN
The National Weather Service in Quad Cities has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Iowa County in east central Iowa... Northern Keokuk County in southeastern Iowa...
* Until 1115 AM CDT.
* At 516 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen, especially across northwest Keokuk County. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. This will be falling on already saturated ground. As a result, Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Marengo, Williamsburg, North English, Victor, What Cheer, Delta, Ladora, Parnell, Millersburg, Conroy, Thornburg, Gibson, Lake Iowa Park, Genoa Bluff, Iowa County Fairgrounds, Keokuk County Fairgrounds, Upper South Amana, South Amana, Coal Creek and West Amana.
This includes Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 205 and 223. Old Mans Creek, Smith Creek, Coal Creek and the South English River.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
